dcterms:creator: Philip Schmidt
Attila Reiss
Robert Duerichen
Claus Marberger
Kristof Van Laerhoven
dcterms:description: WESAD is a multimodal dataset for wearable stress and affect detection with data recorded using a wrist-worn device and a chest-worn device. It consists of 15 subjects with 100 min of data each, aiming to detect and distinguish between three affective states: neutral, stress, and amusement.
dcterms:title: WESAD

dcterms:creator: Sander Koelstra
Christian Muhl
Mohammad Soleymani
Jong-Seok Lee
Ashkan Yazdani
Touradj Ebrahimi
Thierry Pun
Anton Nijholt
Ioannis Patras
dcterms:description: DEAP contains physiological data collected from 32 volunteers while they were watching 40 one-minute-long music videos. The dataset includes EEG, GSR, RESP, SKT, EMG, EOG, BVP data, and self-annotations for arousal, valence, and other emotional states.
dcterms:title: DEAP

dcterms:creator: Juan Abdon Miranda-Correa
Mojtaba Khomami Abadi
Nicu Sebe
Ioannis Patras
dcterms:description: AMIGOS consists of data from sensors (EEG, ECG, GSR), full-body videos, and depth videos from 40 volunteers while watching various videos. It includes self-assessment and external assessment of participants' emotional states.
dcterms:title: AMIGOS

dcterms:creator: Valentina Markova
Todor Ganchev
Kalin Kalinkov
dcterms:description: CLAS dataset includes PPG, EEG, and GSR data from 60 patients engaged in cognitively difficult tasks. It is labeled based on cognitive load during various tasks and aims to recognize affect and stress.
dcterms:title: CLAS
